message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about crop rotation. Crop rotation is an agricultural practice where different crops are planted in a specific order to help maintain soil fertility and prevent the buildup of pests and diseases. Option (B) is the correct answer because it shows a rotation of different crops, such as beans, corn, peas, and cucumbers. Option (A), (C), and (D) all show a repetition of the same crop, which is not the purpose of crop rotation.

This question is related to crop rotation and basic knowledge about farming practices. Crop rotation involves planting different crops in a specific order on the same piece of land to improve soil fertility and control pests and diseases. Option (B) is the correct answer because it represents a rotation of different crops - beans, corn, peas, and cucumbers. Option (A) is incorrect because it represents planting the same crop (tomatoes) repeatedly, which is not the purpose of crop rotation. Option (C) is also incorrect for the same reason, as it represents planting the same crop (beans) repeatedly. Option (D) is incorrect because it represents planting the same crop (corn) repeatedly.
